page.title: 20EVENTS
page.content: Gala Day was on the first Saturday in July. The parade started at two o'clock. The carnival queen and her princess had new dresses, sashes and crowns on. They drove in an old fashioned car with the roof down so that everyone could see them. The route they took was down Mitchell's Avenue, along King's Road, up Parsonage Street and then down the centre of the town to the town gardens. The car broke down and this embaressed the queen and princess. The people all cheered them along the route. In the town gardens Jayne, the queen, presented the trophies to the winners of the various competitions. Gala Day is always a happy day for all the family. There are decorated floats in the parade and lots of things to do throughout the day.
